explanation: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language - the standard language for creating web pages.

text: How many heading levels does HTML provide?
explanation: HTML provides 6 heading levels from h1 (most important) to h6 (least important).

text: Which heading level is the largest and most important?
explanation: h1 is the largest heading and represents the most important content on the page.

text: Who invented the World Wide Web and HTML?
explanation: Sir Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web and created HTML in 1989.

text: Why should you only have one h1 element per page?
options: It helps with SEO and represents the page's main topic
explanation: Having one h1 per page helps search engines understand the page's main topic and improves accessibility.

text: What does `<hr>` create on a webpage?
explanation: <hr> creates a horizontal rule, which appears as a divider line across the page.

text: What is the correct way to skip to the next line in HTML?
explanation:
The
tag creates a line break. Pressing Enter in your code doesn't create visible line breaks in the rendered output.

text: Which is the correct heading hierarchy?
explanation: You should follow the heading hierarchy in order (h1 → h2 → h3) without skipping levels.

text: What does 'Markup' mean in HTML?
explanation: Markup refers to annotations (tags) that mark up content to define its structure, similar to an editor marking up a manuscript.

text: Can you create a website with only an HTML file?
options: Yes, HTML alone can create a valid website
No, you need all three (HTML, CSS, JS)
explanation: You can create a valid website with just HTML. CSS and JavaScript add styling and interactivity but aren't required.
